Data Management (Data Scientist)
The opportunity
EYs global enterprise technology group provides various enabling services (ERP, infrastructure, platforms, service desk) to assist over 300K employees in creating and delivering solutions and services to Fortune 500, privately held and government-like entities.
The Data Scientist will be responsible for leveraging the data lake to drive advanced analytics and predictive modelling initiatives. This role requires a combination of statistical expertise, machine learning knowledge, and the ability to derive insights from large volumes of complex data. The Data Scientist will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and develop data-driven solutions.
Key responsibilities
Develop and implement machine learning models and algorithms to analyze large datasets within the data lake.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions.
Perform exploratory data analysis to understand underlying patterns, correlations, and trends.
Design and execute experiments to test hypotheses and validate data-driven insights.
Create predictive models for forecasting, classification, clustering, and optimization problems.
Interpret and communicate findings to technical and non-technical audiences through clear visualizations and reports.
Integrate advanced analytics into end-user applications and business processes.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of data science techniques, tools, and best practices.
Mentor junior data scientists and analysts, and contribute to the team's skill development.
Ensure adherence to data privacy and security guidelines when handling sensitive information.

A self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion. This individual should possess a combination of technical skills, analytical abilities, and leadership attributes

Programming Languages: Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in data science, such as Python, R, or Scala.
Data Analysis Tools: Experience with data analysis and visualization tools/libraries like Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, or equivalent.
Big Data Technologies: Familiarity with big data technologies and frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, or Databricks.

Deep Learning: Knowledge of deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch is a plus.
Collaboration and Communication: Ability to work effectively in a team environment and communicate complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and creatively in a data-driven approach.
Version Control and Collaboration Tools: Familiarity with version control systems like Git and collaboration tools such as Jupyter Notebooks or Databricks notebooks.

Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.
What you will do
Background
Volvo Group is now starting the transformation journey with the first building block in the Marketing Roadmap supporting the 2025+ strategy. In the first step of this journey, Volvo is transforming from Managed to cloud service enhancing the existing Adobe platform even further. With the aim to improve marketing performance as well as our customer experiences.
In this Platform of Adobe, we are in close collaborating with the selected external IT partner for the system integration and implementation. Volvo Group Digital & IT and other parts of the Volvo organization are involved as well, in many different roles and on many different levels. Cross functional teamwork as its best.
Position Description
Within Volvo Group Digital & IT, we are now looking for an Adobe Cloud Architect, to join us.
As the Architect, you are responsible for the big picture solution design with multiple integrated systems and large data volumes (advising on ETL (Extract, Load, Transform) best practices). You are in control of the data model, and release management for the Cloud implementation enhancement.
Work with the marketing, technology, and architecture representatives to design and implement new customer experience strategies and solutions for the customers. Gather and manage the business requirements and project ideation. Create or contribute to the solution architecture design (SAD).You will translate business requirements into a technology solution and implement that solution in an accurate, efficient, and reliable manner.
You will work in an environment focused on cross-functionality, inclusion, value creation and innovation with our internal network of employees and partners working within Digital & IT, Regions, Dealers and Customer. Develop stronger working relationships with our cross-functional teams impacting the digital interaction within Volvo.
Core Responsibilities:
Design and architect scalable and reliable Adobe Experience Cloud solutions, including Adobe Experience Manager (AEMaaCS), Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Campaign, .
Ensure the security and performance of Adobe Experience Cloud solutions.
Work with Product Owners and stakeholders to gather, understand and define business requirements.
Understand and map business processes & challenges into our architectural landscape, ensuring scalable, secure, comprehensive solution designs.
Collaborate with selected external IT supplier to determine best path for Adobe Cloud platform implementation and enhancement.
Present high-level overviews of the Adobe architecture and integration capabilities.
Identify project issues/risks and present alternatives to alleviate or resolve.
Responsible for the iteratively improving data model and architecture.
Maintain and document technical processes and marketing automation and procedures, SLAs, programs, and workflows.
Work with the Product and Development teams to understand the data and collaborate to identify opportunities for improvement in processing efficiencies.
Who are you?
3-7 years experience as an Adobe Architect
Contributed to different projects/ implementations.
Ability to collaborate effectively with team members in different geographies.
Excellent written (Business & Technical), verbal and listening communication skills.
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Strong Java programming skills applied to Adobe Experience Cloud, enabling advanced customization and robust development.
Portfolio of Adobe Experience Cloud architectural projects, showcasing technical achievements, innovative solutions, and project outcomes.
Adobe certifications is a plus.
We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.
Who we are and what we believe in
Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the groups leading brands and entities.
Group Digital & IT is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries.
